citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - 2011 Riparian Land Cover Proportions by 12-digit HUC for the Conterminous United States

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract:
This EnviroAtlas dataset represents the percentage land area that is classified as forest (excluding wetlands), forest including woody wetlands, and natural land cover that occurs within 45 meters of streams for each 12-digit hydrologic unit code (HUC) in the conterminous United States. Land cover is defined using the EnviroAtlas hybrid Cropland Data Layer (CDL) - 2011 National Land Cover Dataset (NLCD). Steams were derived from the NHDPlus Version 2 dataset.
This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: This dataset is useful for evaluating the potential value of ecosystem services provided by vegetation communities, and the impacts of developed land cover. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

procstep.procdesc: Obtained the EnviroAtlas hybrid 2011 Cropland Data Layer (CDL) and NLCD 2011 land cover raster.
Obtained the NHDPlusV2 Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD) Snapshot, EnviroAtlas version.
Obtained the NHDPlusV2 National Hydrography Dataset (NHD).

Processed each NHDFlowline shapefile in the NHD with the strmLine Tool in the AtlasAnalyses Toolbox (a self-created toolbox for the purpose of standardizing analyses for the EnviroAtlas). The strmLine tool selects line segments from the NHDPlus NHDFlowline layer that are defined as FTYPE = Stream/River or Connector or Artificial Path.

Processed each NHDArea and NHDWaterbody layers in the NHD with the strmAreal Tool in the AtlasAnalyses Toolbox (a self-created toolbox for the purpose of standardizing analyses for the EnviroAtlas). The strmAreal tool extracts Reservoir, LakePond, and Ice Mass waterbodies that intersect the previously processed NHD flowlines and merges them with any NHDArea wash, rapids, streamriver, or lock chambers that also intersect the NHDFlowlines.
Processed new stream line and areal shapefiles to correspond to the areal extents of the WBD datasets.

Calculations were done using the Riparian Land Cover Proportions tool in the Landscape Characteristics toolset of the ATtILA for ArcGIS toolbox (ATtILA 10_0.tbx, 5/26/2016 version) in ArcGIS. Calculated rNI45, rfor45, and rfor9045. Used NHDPlusV2_WBDSnapshot_EnviroAtlas_CONUS as the reporting unit feature, cdl_nlcd as the land cover grid, and the respective stream line and stream areal shapefiles for each WBD region as the stream features. Used a user-defined land cover scheme for the hybrid CDL-NLCD dataset.
Calculation output tables were joined into a single table.
Renamed fields rNI45, rfor45, and rfor9045 to RNAT45, RFOR45, and RFOR9045, respectively.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

enttyp.enttypd: Percentage of land area within 45 meters of stream features in 12-digit hydrologic units classified as various land cover super classes.

attr.attrdef: Twelve Digit Hydrologic Unit Code. This field provides a unique 12-digit code for each subwatershed. Numbers were assigned in an upstream to downstream fashion. Where no downstream/upstream relationship could be determined, numbers were assigned in a clockwise fashion.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Guidelines, Requirements, and Procedures for the National Watershed Boundary Dataset; Chapter 3 of Section A; Federal Standards, Book 11, Collection and Delineation of Spatial Data; Techniques and Methods 11-A3.

attr.attrdef: Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit land area within 45 meters of a stream that is classified as natural land cover (131 - Barren, 141 - Deciduous Forest, 142 - Evergreen Forest, 143 - Mixed Forest, 152 - Shrub/Scrub, 171 - Grassland/Herbaceous, 190 - Woody Wetlands, 195 - Emergent Herbaceous Wetlands). Null indicates no NHDPlusV2 stream features, stream features too small to calculate metrics, or no land in HUC. Null indicates NODATA value in the Canopy grid or no NHDPlus V2 water features.

Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit land area within 45 meters of a stream that is classified as forest (141 - Deciduous Forest, 142 - Evergreen Forest, 143 - Mixed Forest). Null indicates no NHDPlusV2 stream features, stream features too small to calculate metrics, or no land in HUC. Null indicates NODATA value in the Canopy grid or no NHDPlus V2 water features.

Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit land area with 45 meters of a stream that is classified as forest and/or woody wetland (141 - Deciduous Forest, 142 - Evergreen Forest, 143 - Mixed Forest, 190 - Woody Wetlands). Null indicates no NHDPlusV2 stream features, stream features too small to calculate metrics, or no land in HUC. Null indicates NODATA value in the Canopy grid or that none of the NHDPlus V2 water features included in this analysis were present in the HUC12.

overview.eaover: This dataset was generated using the ATtILA tool (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/attila-toolbox), an ArcGIS tool for calculating commonly used landscape metrics. The land cover input is the EnviroAtlas 2011 CDL-NLCD, a raster dataset that is a hybrid of the 2011 NLCD (www.mrlc.gov/) and the 2011 CDL (https://www.nass.usda.gov/Research_and_Science/Cropland/SARS1a.php). The stream inputs were derived from the NHDFlowline, NHDWaterbody, and NHDArea shapefiles in the NHDPlus Version 2 datasets (http://www.horizon-systems.com/NHDPlus/NHDPlusV2_home.php). For more information on the metric calculation, please see the ATtILA User's Manual included with the toolbox. A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps.
